dataaccess

Interface DataAccess


  • public interface DataAccess
    This interface provides access to the Data Access Subsystem services, which include all forms of read/write behavior. Implementations of the Dao interface will provide the necessary data to configure a connection to the intended database.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void atomicRead(Dao dao)
      Performs a single read (SELECT) operation.
      void commit()
      After all jdbc calls have been declared, the commit method should be called, all within a try block.

      Carries out a single SELECT statement as part of a larger transaction.
      void releaseConnection()

      If a commit operation fails in a try block, rollback will undo the transaction if it is called in a catch block.

      Carries out a single INSERT or UPDATE statement as part of a larger transaction.

      void startTransaction()
      Begins a transaction.

    • Method Detail

      • createConnection

        void createConnection(Dao dao)
               throws dataaccess.DatabaseException
        This method starts the data access interaction and permits the use of transactions. The DataAccessSubsystem will keep a reference to the Connection for all future uses in the current instance so the Connection object does not need to be managed by the client.
        Parameters:
        dao - - This is the implementation of the Dao interface that carries the SQL queries and data for interaction with the data store.
        Throws:
        dataaccess.DatabaseException
        See Also:
        Dao

      • releaseConnection

        void releaseConnection()
                throws dataaccess.DatabaseException
        Releases the Connection. Typically, this will mean returning the Connection to the Connection Pool for reuse later.
        Throws:
        dataaccess.DatabaseException

      • startTransaction

        void startTransaction()
               throws dataaccess.DatabaseException
        Begins a transaction. This is equivalent to setting autocommit to false. All jdbc calls made until a commit() call is made will be wrapped into a transaction.
        Throws:
        dataaccess.DatabaseException

      • commit

        void commit()
     throws dataaccess.DatabaseException
        After all jdbc calls have been declared, the commit method should be called, all within a try block. When commit is called, the system will try to perform all indicated jdbc calls within a transaction. If the attempt fails, a DatabaseException will be thrown; this should be caught and should be handled by calling rollback().
        Throws:
        dataaccess.DatabaseException

      • rollback

        void rollback()
       throws dataaccess.DatabaseException
        If a commit operation fails in a try block, rollback will undo the transaction if it is called in a catch block.
        Throws:
        dataaccess.DatabaseException

      • read

        void read()
   throws dataaccess.DatabaseException
        Carries out a single SELECT statement as part of a larger transaction. For reads that are not part of a transaction, use atomicRead(dao)
        Throws:
        dataaccess.DatabaseException

      • save

        java.lang.Integer save()
                throws dataaccess.DatabaseException
        Carries out a single INSERT or UPDATE statement as part of a larger transaction. Writes of any kind should be wrapped in a transaction. For writes that involve only a single jdbc call, use the convenience method saveWithinTransaction().
        Returns:
        Integer - For inserts, the save method returns the auto-generated unique id for the row that was added, if there is one. For updates, there is no return value.
        Throws:
        dataaccess.DatabaseException

      • delete

        java.lang.Integer delete()
                  throws dataaccess.DatabaseException
        Carries out a single DELETE statement as part of a larger transaction. Deletes of any kind should be wrapped in a transaction. For deletes that involve only a single jdbc call, use the convenience method deleteWithinTransaction().
        Returns:
        Integer - Returns the number of rows affected.
        Throws:
        dataaccess.DatabaseException

      • saveWithinTransaction

        java.lang.Integer saveWithinTransaction(Dao dao)
                                 throws dataaccess.DatabaseException
        Convenience method to wrap a single save operation in a transaction. Takes care of getting a Connection, starting the transaction, committing, rolling back if necessary, and releasing the Connection.
        Throws:
        dataaccess.DatabaseException

      • deleteWithinTransaction

        java.lang.Integer deleteWithinTransaction(Dao dao)
                                   throws dataaccess.DatabaseException
        Convenience method to wrap a single delete operation in a transaction. Takes care of getting a Connection, starting the transaction, committing, rolling back if necessary, and releasing the Connection.
        Throws:
        dataaccess.DatabaseException

      • atomicRead

        void atomicRead(Dao dao)
         throws dataaccess.DatabaseException
        Performs a single read (SELECT) operation. Takes care of getting and releasing the Connection.
        Throws:
        dataaccess.DatabaseException
